日本映画専門チャンネル
ＷＯＷＯＷプラス 映画・ドラマ・スポーツ・音楽

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: Discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden in Uda - here the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule as a sanctuary of local culture and history.

programme.title: Yonezawa
programme.desc: Shirabu Onsen: A 700-year-old hot spring, Shirabu Onsen is maintained via daily trips up the slopes of the 2,000-metre mountain where it sits - see the spring's guardian at work in gorgeous footage.

programme.title: Journeys in Japan
programme.desc: Sheila Cliffe follows Japan's Silk Road from Tomioka to the port of Yokohama where she encounters architecture designed for silkworms, modernised reeling machinery, weavers and historians.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture - adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The temple chefs show us how to make su-no-mono with dried daikon radish - just mix rehydrated daikon with red radish and sweet vinegar and this tasty pink-coloured dish is ready to serve.

programme.title: Dining with the Chef
programme.desc: Chef Rika's beef tataki is inspired by Kochi's beloved katsuo no tataki, seared bonito with vegetables - she recreates it with wagyu beef and chilled udon in a refreshing Japanese herb sauce.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Document 72 Hours
programme.desc: A mobile food cart selling a traditional Japanese sweet has been plying the streets of Fukuoka for over 75 years - for three days we talk to customers fond of a snack unchanged over the decades.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.desc: A growing body of research shows that continuing to exercise after a cancer diagnosis can improve post-surgical recovery, reduce recurrence rates, and even increase survival rates.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Deeper Look
programme.desc: What is next for the Olympic Games under its first female president? Historian David Wallechinsky joins us to discuss the future of the IOC, costs, corruption, inclusion and Asia's role.

programme.title: Dig More Japan!
programme.desc: Our theme this time is 'Unknown Japan' - we dig a little deeper and explore some of Japan's hidden charms.

programme.title: Dining with the Chef mini
programme.desc: Learn about Japanese home cooking with Master Chef Saito, who cooks using traditional Japanese cooking techniques, in five minutes! Featured recipe: Beef-wrapped Onigiri.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Journeys in Japan
programme.desc: Sheila Cliffe follows Japan's Silk Road from Tomioka to the port of Yokohama where she encounters architecture designed for silkworms, modernised reeling machinery, weavers and historians.

programme.title: Newsline Asia 24
programme.desc: This daily news programme picks up the key news stories of the past 24 hours from Japan and around Asia.

programme.title: Dining with the Chef
programme.desc: Chef Rika's beef tataki is inspired by Kochi's beloved katsuo no tataki, seared bonito with vegetables - she recreates it with wagyu beef and chilled udon in a refreshing Japanese herb sauce.

programme.title: Newsline Asia 24
programme.desc: This daily news programme picks up the key news stories of the past 24 hours from Japan and around Asia.

programme.desc: A mobile food cart selling a traditional Japanese sweet has been plying the streets of Fukuoka for over 75 years - for three days we talk to customers fond of a snack unchanged over the decades.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Deeper Look
programme.desc: What is next for the Olympic Games under its first female president? Historian David Wallechinsky joins us to discuss the future of the IOC, costs, corruption, inclusion and Asia's role.

programme.title: Bosai: Science That Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: Disaster Response Robots: If disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people if fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents prevent smooth recovery - that's where robots can help.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.desc: A growing body of research shows that continuing to exercise after a cancer diagnosis can improve post-surgical recovery, reduce recurrence rates, and even increase survival rates.

programme.title: NHK News 7
programme.desc: An evening news bulletin that provides Japan's views on many domestic and international news events.

programme.title: Journeys in Japan
programme.desc: Sheila Cliffe follows Japan's Silk Road from Tomioka to the port of Yokohama where she encounters architecture designed for silkworms, modernised reeling machinery, weavers and historians.

programme.title: Newsroom Tokyo
programme.desc: This programme gives you comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia, explaining the day's developments and what is behind them.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Afuso Michie is a Japanese-Brazilian woman who runs a centre in Kanagawa Prefecture that offers Japanese language classes and other services which help foreign residents find their footing.

programme.title: DOSUKOI Sumo Salon
programme.desc: This time, a technique involving clamping the opponent's shoulder then pulling them down - we take a close look and examine why the under-shoulder swing down is becoming more popular!

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords
programme.desc: Admired since ancient times for their beauty, Japanese swords are amazing works of art - this time, a powerful weapon with a beautiful hamon: Daihannya Nagamitsu.

programme.title: Ukiyo-e Edo-Life
programme.desc: With its splendid branches and white plum blossoms, this famous painting is known for captivating Van Gogh - discover why people were able to tell this was a specific tree at Kameido Umeyashiki.

programme.title: Newsroom Tokyo
programme.desc: This programme gives you comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia, explaining the day's developments and what is behind them.

programme.title: Science View
programme.desc: There is a doctor who is working to develop drugs to treat myotonic dystrophy, an incurable disease - we take a closer look at Professor Masayuki Nakamori of Yamaguchi University and his challenge.

programme.title: Ama Divers Restoring the Seabed
programme.desc: Natural disasters devastated the fishing grounds of the ama (free divers) in Wajima in Noto Prefecture in 2024 - we follow their efforts to survey the seabed and revive their tradition.

programme.title: Dive in Tokyo
programme.desc: We visit Hakone in Kanagawa Prefecture - once the site of a security checkpoint for traffic in and out of old Tokyo, it evolved into a hot spring resort with an increasingly diverse community.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Otani Akira's book 'The Night of Baba Yaga' won the UK's prestigious Dagger Prize for crime fiction in translation, a first for a Japanese author, in 2025 - she shares the inspiration behind her work.

programme.title: Japan's Top Inventions
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind renowned Japanese products alongside our reporter - this time, super-absorbent towels.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Frontrunners
programme.desc: Watanabe Hiroki is co-founder of an NGO in Bangladesh that gives long-term support to underprivileged children on the street and proves that they can make a positive contribution to society.

programme.desc: Every hero needs a good villain, and kabuki has everything from ambitious schemers to vile seducers and even the odd comic villain. Actor Kataoka Ainosuke explores the roles' appeal.

programme.title: Newsroom Tokyo
programme.desc: This programme gives you comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia, explaining the day's developments and what is behind them.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Sake brewer Noguchi Naohiko has made significant contributions to the sake industry over his seven-decade career - he talks about carrying on old traditions while innovating new ones.

programme.title: DOSUKOI Sumo Salon
programme.desc: We look at the penultimate 14th day of sumo tournaments and dive into historical moments, like an emotional brotherly title win, that prove that this day can be as or more exciting than the final one!

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords
programme.desc: Admired since ancient times for their beauty, Japanese swords are amazing works of art - this time, a blade wielded by the world's most famous swordsman Miyamoto Musashi: Musashi Masamune.

programme.title: Ukiyo-e Edo-Life
programme.desc: Mornings begin early for fishmongers and vegetable peddlers at Nihonbashi Bridge for a reason; they are not going to bow to the lord's procession in this bustling scene from everyday Edo life.
